0.description: The office has a store room for keeping and securing equipment, supplies and materials purchased.
The institution maintains a Supply Management Office (SMO) managed by qualified staff with specific functions and responsibilities.

The Bids and Awards Committee (BAC) is responsible for the procurement and deliveries of needed equipment, supplies and materials in accordance with the approved Annual Procurement Plan (APP) and Project Procurement Management Plan (PPMP).
The Bids and Awards Committee (BAC) performs its tasks and responsibilities in accordance with recent procurement policies and official issuances.
The SMO prepares, evaluates and submits the annual inventory of serviceable and non-serviceable facilities and equipment.

The institution has a system of records keeping.
The institution has policies and procedures to ensure the security and confidentiality of records.
Policies and procedures on prompt release of records are in place.
The institution maintains a Record Management Office (RMO) managed by a qualified Records Officer.
A record system is installed in offices where it allows easy access to information needed by concerned parties.
The Human Resource Management Office (HRMO) maintains accurate, up-to-date and systematically filed records of faculty and non-teaching personnel.
The following updated record compilations are made available to concerned parties:

1.description: Minutes of the Board of Regents/Trustees meetings.

2.description: Minutes of the faculty meetings, e.g., Academic Council meetings.

5.description: Other records such as student directory, alumni directory, permanent records of students, reports of Director/Dean, annual reports, accomplishment/progress reports, scholarship records, statistical data, financial records of students, inventory of property, proceedings of administrative investigation (if any), and others.

0.description: The institution has a commendable Records Management System.
